General Practice.instructions: Use standard SOAP structure. Summarize pertinent positives/negatives. Avoid fabricating data. Use 'Not provided' when missing.

Hospital Medicine.instructions: Be concise for handoff/readability. Include overnight events, vitals trends, and disposition.

Emergency Medicine.instructions: Prioritize life-threats, stability, time-course, and immediate diagnostics/interventions.

Cardiology.instructions: Emphasize chest pain quality, risk factors, ECG/troponin status, hemodynamics, and ACS risk.

Pulmonology.instructions: Focus on dyspnea, cough, wheeze, SpO2, imaging status, and exacerbation triggers.
